The mission of Shift Thinking is to update leaders' mental models for a digital age.  As Albert Einstein once said, "We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking that created them."  Shifts are happening in every arena of business and society:  products to platforms; hierarchies to networks; audience to community; push to pull.  Innovations often bog down when people don't have a mental model to understand them.  Shift Thinking delivers keynotes, facilitates workshops, and leads journeys that build new capability and culture.  Our work deepens customer engagement, accelerates transformational change, and drives exponential growth.

As a faculty member of Singularity University, I work in areas of innovation, change and entrepreneurship, helping companies adopt an exponential mindset:  understanding the nature of exponential technologies, their implications for growth, change and value creation; and the dynamics of managing organizations that are both incremental and exponential.

summary: My mission is to change the way people think. I believe that to stay competitive and relevant in the digital age, you have to change not only what you do, but how you think. As the founder and Chief Epiphany Officer of Shift Thinking. I help leaders and organizations make the shift from incremental to exponential growth and achieve transformative change so they can more effectively compete in their market, engage their customers and organize their teams. I have been a pioneer and guide to the digital revolution since receiving Harvard University’s first doctorate on the topic of social media in 1997. I have launched new businesses, created award-winning programs, and advised global leaders for such organizations as McKinsey & Company, The Economist, IBM, Adobe, Kaiser Permanente and the American Heart Association. I am also a frequent speaker on topics such as Digital Disruption, New Models of Customer Engagement, Networked Leadership, Thinking Styles and Unlearning. I am a regular contributor to Harvard Business Review and an Adjunct Faculty member of Singularity University. To learn more about my work, book me to speak at an event or find out how Shift Thinking can help your business, please visit www.shift.to.
